channel.title: CSIS — Analysis (custom RSS)
channel.description: Auto-generated RSS feed for CSIS Analysis pages.

item.title: USAID Youth Engagement: A Potential Generation Lost?
item.description: The halting of USAID’s youth programming represents a critical inflection point for U.S. development policy. The termination risks reversing gains in employment, social cohesion, and civic participation that underpin economic and democratic resilience.

item.title: A Complex Legacy: U.S. Global Food Security Assistance, 2008–Present
item.description: Among U.S. global development programs paused or terminated in 2025 are those that aimed to improve global agriculture and nutrition. Through an interactive graphic, CSIS explores the history and status of U.S. government funding for eight of these programs.

item.title: Watered Down: A Weakened Global Water Strategy
item.description: The US Global Water Strategy reflects longstanding bipartisan commitments to promote safe water services in partner nations. The Trump administration’s radical reductions to foreign aid imperil these goals, making vulnerable populations weaker, poorer, and less secure.

item.title: How U.S. Democracy, Human Rights, and Governance Cuts Could Undermine Global Development Gains
item.description: While the Trump administration dismantled much of the foreign assistance ecosystem, democracy, human rights, and governance programming and approaches were particularly targeted. Any development work without these efforts is unsustainable.

item.title: How Mexico’s Costly Spectrum Undermines Its Digital Future
item.description: CSIS Americas experts assess how Mexico's high fees for wireless spectrum undermine its competitiveness ahead of the 2026 USMCA Joint Review.
